name: Grand Hyatt Berlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have used and enjoyed the Hyatt Club floor arrangement before, and were not disappointed in Berlin, which is a magnificent city and so worth a visit. The Club level rooms are very comfortable, spacious and quiet and have gorgeous bathrooms. The Club lounge set-up is excellent, continental breakfast is available - very generous, altho no hot food - cakes/snacks from 3pm to 5pm (most people are out sightseeing) and a 'buffet' from 6pm until 8pm. Not the biggest buffet in the world, but more than enough for us. Free wine/beer/sparkling wine during these two hours also, and very generous amounts. The club lounge was a home from home and we relaxed there in the evenings over a couple of glasses of wine, before having an evening stroll and then turning in after a day's sightseeing. Berlin is a must-see city and don't forget Potsdam - a history buff's treat - and the Hyatt is the place to stay. We loved it. Buy the 2 or 3 day transport pass for 18 or 22 euros, you can hop on and off U-bahns, S-bahns and buses all day.
reviews.title: As good as all the reviews say

reviews.text: I went on a big European family vacation this summer with the whole clan (four adults, three kids, four countries, 3 weeks), and one of the highlights was the Grand Hyatt in Berlin; by far the best hotel in a trip filled with wonderful stays. I apologize for the length of this review in advance, but I just can't say enough about this amazing place.
reviews.title: WoW, what a great hotel!

likes.disliked: — The air conditioner was a little weak... but not a concern in Germany most of the time!

reviews.text: What a gorgeous hotel, and just what you imagine Berlin might be: stark, modern, clean, and efficient (such a nice change from the "old world" feel of all the hotels in Rome, Paris and London). I don't know a lot about Berlin (it was my first visit), but this hotel is really in a great area to explore. There are numerous museums, a big shopping mall, a huge live theater (Blue Man Group had just opened), an IMAX theater (and film museum), all within blocks of this hotel (and the kids loved the Mc Donald's next door!). Oh, and and the Starbuck's right across the street was nice too.
reviews.title: Loved the Grand Hyatt
Very nice hotel
reviews.text: We had three rooms in total: my folks had a one-bedroom corner suite on the third floor and we had two separate (two queen bed) rooms on the concierge floor (I think the 23rd floor). The suite was a real gem, with a nice view out of the corner living room that overlooked the front entrance of the hotel. The mini bar was COMPLIMENTARY (the kids loved this, as they had been forbidden to enter the mini bars in any of our previous hotels!), and there was even a stocked bar with liquor as well as a complimentary bottle of wine (my dad cracked this open right away) and a beautiful bowl of fresh fruit and cheese. There was also a DVD player with a BOSE surround sound system in the living room (There was large selection of DVD's to choose from in the concierge club room as well, with lot's of family friendly entertainment). The floor to ceiling doors opened to a bedroom with a king bed. The decor was modern (almost "cubist") and predominantly black (of course!), but suprisingly the room was not "dark". Our rooms on the upper floors were just as nice for "regular" rooms. I loved the utterly modern feel of this hotel. walking down the hallways felt like you were in a futuristic sci-fi movie or on a spaceship. Even the "do not disturb" signs on each door is a push button light!

reviews.title: Memorable stay
reviews.text: I just returned from spending three nights at this hotel on business. I've stayed at a lot of hotels all over the world and this is definitely up there with the best. The service is quite likely the best (and most subtle) I've ever experienced. In fact, everything about the hotel is non-intrusive. The rooms with glorious bathrooms, Aveda amenities, a swimming pool that was all mine every morning I used it, a plentiful buffet breakfast surpassed only by Hotel Arts in Barcelona, a Herald Tribune AND USA Today readily available...In short, a terrific hotel in a fabulous location. If I have any complaints at all it would have to be the coffee. It's just not that good. But that's not a problem as there's a Starbucks across the street...

we are family of four took two bedrooms connected for six days. Paid in advance for better price. We enjoyed the hotel and the area very much. Sony building next to it which was very enjoyable to the teens. I too ejoyed the Beer garden at the Soney Centre. Have used the Hyatt restruant several times which is very good. We prefer the one next to the reseption due to food and informal comparing to the large one indoors/outdoors. Can not remember the name.
reviews.title: Best Hyatt

likes.disliked: — Run out of coffee - only non-cafine coffee was available in the bedroom for few days which surprised me.

reviews.text: Unbelievable service from the moment you walk in the door. Not enough superlatives to describe the efficiency and friendliness, even down to the maids. Great location in Potzdammer Platz and lots of nearby restaurants and entertainment. The room was wonderful from the bed to the incredible shower/bath. Worth the price.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel
Impression of two wolrd travellers (not on bussiness)
reviews.text: Could not say enough good things about this hotel. It exceeds 4* expectation. It is quite modern hotel, with modern furniture and decorations. Staff is quite helpful and friendly. We were surprised to arrive in our room and find a bottle of Champagne, lovely truffles and a special note to us. A really nice touch.
The breakfast buffet at the VOXX restaurant is great. They offer a variety of fishes, cheeses, and charcuterie. Lovely breads, fruits, juices, etc.
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.text: I would only say, if you are travelling for leasure, don't be surprised to see many business travellers.
reviews.title: Service at its best

likes.disliked: — A little anonymous in its elegance

reviews.text: A fantastic hotel with great staff. Very professional and courteous. In short, the kind of hotel experience you expect but don't often get. No complaints whatsoever...
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel experience...

reviews.text: This was the most luxurious hotel I've ever stayed at. We stayed on the club floor, and you can see from the pictures--it is very sleek and modern. The bed was very slightly hard, but provided a comfortable night's sleep. It was the most comfortable bed I've slept in Europe so far. The bathroom was just the coolest. The bathtub and shower were enclosed by a glass door. There was also a TV monitor in the bathroom that was connected from the TV in the main area.
reviews.title: Luxurious Stay on Club Floor

likes.liked: — Modern design and amenities, location, outstanding service.
likes.disliked: — Need the room key to turn lights on (at least on club floor). Some issue with one light not turning off.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was excellent during the stay. Housekeeping was prompt and cleaned the room while I was in the gym for an hour in the morning. The staff serving the club floor private lounge were all very kind and provided outstanding, friendly service. Besides breakfast, they served cakes and snacks during the day, and some appetizers/wine in the evening. Sebastian, the evening concierge in the main lobby, was also excellent and provided great dining recommendations each night we were there.
reviews.title: Still My Global Favourite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooftop hotel gym and pool were great facilities and offered beautiful views of the city.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel
Modern design, friendly staff
reviews.text: This is a great area, convenient to all tourist attractions and the S and U-bahn. It is right near a shopping mall, casino, and near plenty of restaurants.

description: Innovative design, clean-cut lines, first-class natural materials and contemporary art are characteristical for Grand Hyatt Berlin located at Berlin Mitte, close to Potsdamer Platz, Brandenburg Gate and Reichstag. The 342 luxurious guestrooms and suites are equipped with B&O flat screen TVs and Wi-Fi. Grand Hyatt Berlin features restaurants Vox, Tizian and mesa, Vox Bar and Club Olympus Spa & Fitness on the rooftop which offers a large pool, cutting-edge fitness equipment, a sauna and Jacuzzi.
